conclusion: Analyze forces acting on bodies A, B, and C
Body A has mass m and is resting on a rough surface with gravitational force mg downward, normal force F upward, and frictional force f opposing horizontal motion
Body B has mass 2m and is resting on a rough surface with gravitational force 2mg downward, normal force F_B upward, and frictional force f_B opposing horizontal motion
Body C has mass m with a smooth outer surface, gravitational force mg downward, and two normal forces N from bodies A and B acting at an angle
All bodies are at rest, net force in horizontal and vertical directions must be zero
For body A: F = mg + N cos(theta)
For body B: F_B = 2mg + N cos(theta)
For body A: f = N sin(theta)
For body B: f_B = N sin(theta)
Body C is symmetrical and placed between A and B, horizontal components of normal forces cancel out
Solve for N: N = mg / (2 cos(theta))
Substitute N into equations for F and f: F = 3mg/2, f = mg/2 cos(theta) sin(theta)
Maximum static friction equals sliding friction: f = mu F
Equate expressions for f: mg/2 cos(theta) sin(theta) = sqrt(3)mg/4
Magnitude of normal force F exerted by ground on A is 3mg/2
Magnitude of frictional force f is sqrt(3)mg/4
